author: Mohammed Iqbal
text:
The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) intends to file a petition in the Delhi High Court seeking vacation of an interim order of Himachal Pradesh High Court restraining the investigating agency from arresting, interrogating or filing chargesheet against Chief Minister Virbhadra Singh in a disproportionate assets case.

Mr. Singh’s writ petition seeking quashing of an FIR lodged against him by the CBI was transferred from Himachal Pradesh to the Delhi High Court on the Supreme Court’s direction on November 5 last year.

Additional Solicitor General P.S. Patwalia told a Bench of Justice Pratibha Rani on Thursday that the CBI’s investigation in the case was being hampered as a result of the interim stay order of October 1, 2015. He said the CBI would file an application seeking to vacate the order.

Next hearing on April 4

The Bench posted the matter for further hearing on April 4.

Mr. Singh’s petition had alleged that the searches at his private residence were conducted by the investigating agency with mala fide intentions and political vendetta.
title: Virbhadra case: CBI to file plea against stay order
